results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Legal Profession;Murdaugh, Randolph IV (Randy) (1966- );Murdaugh, Alex (1968- );Murdaugh, Margaret (d 2021);Murdaugh, Paul (d 2021);South Carolina
results.title: Breaking Silence, Murdaugh Brother Says ‘Not Knowing Is the Worst Thing’
results.abstract: After Alex Murdaugh’s trial ended in a conviction for the murders of his wife and son, his older brother Randy is still trying to understand what happened that night.

media.caption: “He knows more than what he’s saying,” Randy Murdaugh said of his brother, who was convicted of murder last week. “He’s not telling the truth, in my opinion, about everything there.”

results.adx_keywords: Television
results.title: Jimmy Fallon Recaps Trump’s ‘Off the Rails’ CPAC Speech
results.abstract: Fallon said Donald Trump “made some pretty intense promises” in his headlining speech on Saturday.

media.caption: “He’s either running for president or auditioning to be the next John Wick,” Jimmy Fallon joked of Donald Trump on Monday.

results.adx_keywords: Kidnapping and Hostages;Salazar, Ken;Lopez Obrador, Andres Manuel;Matamoros (Mexico);Mexico;Brownsville (Tex)
results.byline: By Natalie Kitroeff, Maria Abi-Habib, Jack Nicas and Jacey Fortin
results.title: A Trip to Mexico Ends in a Kidnapping and the Deaths of 2 Americans
results.abstract: Four friends crossed the border on Friday, but within hours, they were abducted by gunmen and two of them were killed before the others were rescued Tuesday.

media.caption: The scene where gunmen kidnapped four U.S. citizens in Matamoros, Mexico.

results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Digestive Tract;Long Covid;Research;Coronavirus Risks and Safety Concerns;Stomach;your-feed-healthcare;Nature Communications (Journal);Veterans Health Administration
results.title: Long Covid Patients More Likely to Have Gastrointestinal Problems, Study Finds
results.abstract: The study, which examined patients infected early in the pandemic, found they were significantly more likely than people who didn’t get Covid to experience lingering reflux, constipation and other issues.

media.caption: A long Covid patient received a checkup last year. A study of more than 154,000 Covid patients found that they were 36 percent more likely to have gastrointestinal problems a year later than people who didn’t get Covid.

results.adx_keywords: Kidnapping and Hostages;Drug Cartels;Federal Bureau of Investigation;Matamoros (Mexico);Mexico;Tamaulipas (Mexico);Brownsville (Tex)
results.title: 4 Americans Kidnapped in Mexico Border City Were There Seeking Health Care
results.abstract: The four came under fire shortly after entering the city of Matamoros from Brownsville, Texas. The F.B.I. is offering a $50,000 reward for their return and the arrest of the kidnappers.

media.caption: Amy soldiers during a search for four Americans who were kidnapped by gunmen last week, in Matamoros, Mexico, on Monday.

results.title: Ben Savage, ‘Boy Meets World’ Actor, Is Running for Congress

media.caption: Ben Savage in 2018. Mr. Savage, the former “Boy Meets World” actor, said that he was running for Congress.

results.byline: By Neil MacFarquhar and Milana Mazaeva
results.title: He Heeded Russia’s Call to Enlist. Five Months Later, He Was Dead.
results.abstract: Pvt. Ivan Ovlashenko was one of at least 16,000 Russians who have died in Ukraine, more than in the Soviets’ Afghan war. It’s getting hard for the Kremlin to cover that up.

media.caption: Ivan Ovlashenko, who signed up to serve in the Russian military after receiving a mobilization summons last fall, in a photo provided by his family.

results.title: China’s Leader, With Rare Bluntness, Blames U.S. Containment for Troubles
results.abstract: Xi Jinping criticized what he called a U.S.-led campaign of “encirclement and suppression.” His new foreign minister said it was impossible for China not to fight back.

media.caption: Xi Jinping, China’s leader, at the opening of a meeting of the top legislature in Beijing on Sunday. He has held China up as a model that offers a different path to prosperity that rejects liberal democracy.

results.title: Five Women Sue Texas Over the State’s Abortion Ban
results.abstract: The women, backed by an abortion-rights group, say they were denied abortions under state law despite risks to themselves and their fetuses that made the procedure a medical necessity.
des_facet: Dobbs v Jackson Women's Health Organization (Supreme Court Decision)

media.caption: Unable to obtain a selective abortion in Texas that was needed to save her own life and that of one of the twins she was carrying, Lauren Miller traveled to Colorado for the procedure. She is due to deliver the surviving twin later this month.
media.copyright: Nitashia Johnson for The New York Times

results.byline: By Jim Tankersley and Margot Sanger-Katz
results.title: Biden Budget Will Propose Tax Increase to Bolster Medicare
results.abstract: The president’s plan targets Americans earning more than $400,000 a year in an attempt to increase the program’s solvency by 25 years.

media.caption: By focusing on Medicare in the budget and before its release, President Biden is seeking to sharpen a contrast with Republicans and cast himself as a protector of cherished retirement programs.

results.title: Joseph Zucchero, Whose Sandwich Shop Inspired ‘The Bear,’ Dies at 69
results.abstract: Mr. Beef, the Chicago restaurant Mr. Zucchero co-founded in the 1970s, specializes in the Italian beef, a classic American sandwich. The acclaimed FX series “The Bear” was partly filmed there.

media.caption: Mr. Beef on North Orleans Street in Chicago in October.

results.title: The Best Way to Comfort Someone When They’re Sad
results.abstract: A limited yet growing body of research suggests that one of the most powerful ways to support someone is also the simplest: Start a conversation.

results.title: Preterm Birth Drug Withdrawn After 12 Years
results.abstract: The F.D.A. seemed poised to rescind approval of Makena, after studies over time indicated the treatment did not halt early childbirth for many women.

media.caption: The F.D.A. had been weighing the latest studies, which did not prove a benefit for pregnant women facing preterm birth.

results.title: With a Marijuana Shop on ‘Every Corner,’ Oklahoma Rejects Full Legalization
results.abstract: The state has embraced medical marijuana, with some 400 dispensaries in Oklahoma City alone. But voters decided against going further.

media.caption: James Smith, president of the Oklahoma Association of Chiefs of Police, addressed the No on 820 rally in Oklahoma City on Monday.
